title: Minute Breakfast Burrito Recipe
description: Fill a tortilla with microwaved scrambled egg, salsa, and a slice of American cheese for a fast and filling DIY breakfast for the road.

Burrito Recipes Minute Breakfast Burrito 4.8 (4) 3 Reviews 3 Photos A fast DIY breakfast for the road that's made in minutes with scrambled egg, salsa, and cheese wrapped up in a tortilla. By Allrecipes Member Updated on March 26, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 3 mins Cook Time: 2 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 1 Yield: 1 burrito Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 2 large eggs 2 tablespoons salsa 1 slice reduced-fat American cheese 1 tortilla Directions Gather all ingredients. Allrecipes / Qi Ai Spray a cereal bowl with nonstick cooking spray. Crack the eggs into the bowl, add the salsa, and stir. Allrecipes / Qi Ai Microwave on high for 1 minute, stir, and cook for another minute or until the mixture firms up. Allrecipes / Qi Ai Place cheese in center of tortilla and top with egg mixture. Allrecipes / Qi Ai Wrap it all up like a burrito and head for the car! Allrecipes / Qi Ai I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 465 Calories 23g Fat 41g Carbs 25g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 1 Calories 465 % Daily Value * Total Fat 23g 29% Saturated Fat 9g 45% Cholesterol 392mg 131% Sodium 1148mg 50% Total Carbohydrate 41g 15% Dietary Fiber 3g 10% Total Sugars 4g Protein 25g 50% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 303mg 23% Iron 4mg 24% Potassium 342mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Minute Breakfast Burrito 01 of 03 Photo by  Allrecipes / Qi Ai 02 of 03 Photo by  LovesCooking 03/23/2025 Crowd-pleaser Great flavors This was the fastest and tastiest burrito to make at home. And it’s so versatile too, you can add so many more things depending on your preferences such as cheese, sliced meats, pickles, peppers and so on. Perfect for hectic mornings where you need to go to flavor town really quickly. Crowd pleaser all the way. 03 of 03 Photo by  France C 12/06/2022 What a quick way to prepare a meal on the go! However, I don't think I'd "head to the car" with it, as stated, because this can get messy. The cook time was spot on. The first time I made this it was a fail. I used a regular size tortilla and that wasn't nearly big enough and everything fell apart. Note that you will have to use a large 10-inch tortilla to get this to work. I made it a second time and everything worked out great, but I added a sprinkle of salt this time and it taste better. The only thing I'd suggest is using a cheddar slice instead of American cheese. I also warmed up my tortilla in the microwave for about 15 seconds prior to rolling everything up. 1 You’ll Also Love Crispy Rolled Breakfast Burrito 9 Ratings Easy Egg and Avocado Breakfast Burrito 34 Ratings Southwest Breakfast Burritos 105 Ratings Easy Money Breakfast Burritos 27 Ratings Avocado and Egg Breakfast Burrito 5 Ratings Flannery's Bacon Avocado Burritos 5 Ratings Make-Ahead Air Fryer Breakfast Burritos 5 Ratings Bacon and Egg Tacos 22 Ratings Big Bob's Big Brunch Quesadillas 11 Ratings Freeze-and-Reheat Breakfast Burritos 30 Ratings Waynesboroughs 12 Ratings Egg Pesto Breakfast Wrap 27 Ratings Spinach Feta Egg Wrap 7 Ratings Good Morning Wrap 25 Ratings Easy Huevos Rancheros 140 Ratings Breakfast Burritos 148 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
